post_text: April 18, 2018 at 12:10 AM#1GLADs IntelliVars are small Lua scripts embedded in$variables for easy direct access via commandline/macros.These may be useful for people who find Lua too scary and complicated but still want a piece of the pie, served within their comfort zone of commandline and macrosDownload the attached Macro, import and run it once, tobuild the variables and get access to the functions described below----------------------------$CAPTURE----------------------------calling this variable creates temporary new variables C_.... containing properties of the current destination.Example:CodeCD Preset 1.1$CAPTURECD /(add a small wait (>0.05s) to the $capture line, to allow the captureprocess finish before continuing with the macro)Result:Code$C_SPECIAL = Normal$C_NO = 1.1$C_NAME = Opento not flood your list of vars, these temporary C_variables will self-delete after 1 second, so make sure to use, or copy the ones you need, in the proceeding lines of your macro:CodeSetUserVar $myNameForLater = $"C_NAME"----------------------------$LOOP***----------------------------The LOOP IntelliVars may be used for repeating commandssimilar to a regular FOR loop.Example:Code$LOOPFROM 1 ; $LOOPTO 3$LOOPCMD "Fixture @ At 50 ; Store Exec 10@"$LOOPCMDADD " ; Label Exec 10@ 'F@' "$LOOPRUNResult:CodeFixture 1 At 50Store Exec 101Label Exec 101 "F1"Fixture 2 At 50Store Exec 102Label Exec 102 "F2"Fixture 3 At 50Store Exec 103Label Exec 103 "F3"Use @ wherever in they syntax where you want toinsert the loopcounter.If you need quotes inside your syntax, use single quotes,(they gets replaced with regular double quotes when loop is executed)Remember to start with semicolon and space in the cmdtext, if you want to add additional syntax via $LOOPCMDADD .----------------------------------$FORMULA, $CALCULATE----------------------------------These IntelliVars may be used to perform arithmetic operations on uservariablesExample:Code$FORMULA "$myresult=($var1+$var2)/2" ; $CALCULATEsets the uservariable $myresult to the mean average of $var1 and $var2.Happy programmingAndreasFilesGLADs intelliVars v2b.xml5.34 kB – 267 Downloads

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: June 14, 2018 at 12:10 AM#7the $capture will grab properties from the current commandline destination:you need to utilize the ChangeDestination command (CD) and the open end macroline (@)CodeCD @$captureCD /this will put CD in the commandline and wait for you to complete the syntax.when you tap on Preset 4.2 the commandline will be executed asCodeCD Preset 4.2and the commandline destination is changed toPresets/Global/Color 4/Preset 4.2/which the Lua script can detect and extract information from via the intellivarCode$capturethen you change the destination back to Root withCodeCD /

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: June 14, 2018 at 12:10 PM#9Please reread the instructions in my initial post.the autocreated variables like $C_NO cannot be usedLATER(they are temporary, and will selfdestruct shortly after creation)add additional lines in the macro right after the "CD /" line to permanently save the $C_variable(s) you need:the macroline with $capture needs a small wait to allow the capture process to complete (0.1sec), so that you do not try to use e.g. $C_NO before it has been created, but you also need to use $C_NO before it selfdestructs (1sec)try this codeCodeCD @$capture [wait:0.1]CD /Setvar $MyCapturedNumber = $"C_NO"the $MyCapturedNumber variable should work as you expect.

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: September 1, 2019 at 2:46 PM#14the attachment in the original post have been updated with a bugfix:short story:In some scenarios, the cleanup of temporary $C_ variables failed.long story:the CuePart object has a series of showfile specific properties(PresetType-timing)the name of these properties are dynamically created based on preset-type naming in attribute-setup, and the names of these presettime properties are not accessible via the property.name function, so the script failed when trying to generate C_name for an unamed property.
